Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory748.jpg
Holding your breath, you focus on the drum before you.
Your wrists begin to move almost automatically, aiming to recreate the score in your mind.
Feeling the vibration of the strings, you listen to the melodious sound that follows.
A bright melody and a deep chorus accompany you just in time.
Your heart almost skips a beat from the nervousness, but your body has seemingly adapted to the rhythm.
(Now, the final part...)
No longer needing to consciously recall the notes on the score, you complete the beat until the finale as if something is guiding your wrists.
You strike the final note with all your might, marking the end of the performance.
Sparse applause breaks out around you after a brief moment of silence.
Kiske
Thank you, everyone—thank you for listening to our latest single!
Kiske
I'd also like to thank this human specifically. This is the Babylonia commandant 【kuroname】, who filled in for our drummer today. We really appreciate it!
(Bow)
Thank you, everyone!
Mechanoid Audience
Encore! Encore!
Kiske
My apologies, but that's it for our performance today. Please keep supporting "Thunder Sparks" in the future!
The leading mechanoid waves its mechanical arm at the audience instead of bowing before leading you and the band backstage.
Kiske
I thought we were screwed without Kelly today. Thank goodness you were here to help.
I didn't really play that well.
I was just winging it.
After being liberated from back-to-back missions and troublesome situations, you were finally assigned a short vacation from the command center.
With progress being made on Constellia's reconstruction, Celica recommended Gray Raven take a vacation there to refresh your spirits.
Due to the series of recent events, Lucia and the others are constantly worried about potential trauma you might be experiencing.
Despite your reassurances, they cannot help but pay more attention to your every move when you are all together.
To stop them from worrying about you too much, you proposed splitting up during the vacation so the squad can fully recover from the shadows of recent events.
Having convinced everyone, you wandered the streets aimlessly when a mechanoid named "Kiske" pulled you over and asked you to fill in as their band's drummer.
Apparently, their original drummer had too much special electrolyte the previous night and was found unconscious with memory data issues in an alley just two hours before the show.
Although it was a bit of a stretch to ask for your help, you luckily had picked up some basics of music theory and instruments after having dealt with WGAA for so long.
Their setlist was not particularly challenging as well, so you managed to learn enough of your parts to perform on stage.
Kiske
How about we treat you to some special gas-booze at Vasi's as a thank you?
I appreciate the gesture...
Ahem... I'm not used to drinking this stuff...
Since Iris Warbler discovered Constellia, your understanding of what the Science Council named "awakened machines" has evolved with each interaction.
The awakened machines staying in Constellia seem to only be a tiny fraction. Their behavior differs greatly from normal mechanoids, but their minds are still much more innocent than those of humans.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory673.jpg
Perhaps influenced by the awakened machine known as Cervantes, all those staying in Constellia have developed a keen interest in art.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory675.jpg
Thanks to the efforts of Ayla, Sica, and the members of WGAA, these awakened machines get along fairly well with the humans in Constellia nowadays.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory671.jpg
Moreover, the city hides many secret areas known only to awakened machines, accessible only to humans trusted by them.
The stage you performed on and the "Vasi's" Kiske mentioned are among these secrets.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory669.jpg
Curious as you may be, you politely decline Kiske's invitation nonetheless. After all, "gas-booze" does not sound too stomach-friendly to humans.
When's the next performance?
Kiske
Very soon! We'll invite you for sure!
I look forward to it.
Kiske
Thunder Sparks isn't the only one performing there. The Paradise Festival is going to be a great time! Don't miss it!
Paradise Festival?
Kiske suddenly mentions something you have not heard of while you say goodbye to each other.
Before you can ponder what the Paradise Festival is, a voice zooms past you, catching your attention.
Kareninaaa—waaait—can't we talk this out?
How many times do I have to say it?! I'm not wearing it!
Just take another look at this coating—maybe you'll change your mind!
I looked! That's why I don't want to put it on!
Karenina... and Ayla?
You recognize the two figures running toward you. Karenina flees desperately, looking utterly distraught, while Ayla pursues her with a mix of amusement and frustration.
Karenina
Commandant? Tch... Come help me already!
Karenina is slightly surprised to see you. However, after a brief contemplation, she grits her teeth and stops running, hiding behind you instead.
Ayla
Karenina, just stop running first...
Ayla
Oh, Commandant? Hello!
Why are you chasing Karenina?
Ayla
I just wanted Karenina to try on a new coating WGAA designed, but she seems really against it for some reason.
Ayla
Whatever she doesn't like about it, she needs to try it on so I can give feedback to the designers to make adjustments...
Karenina
Wait... Don't you know what the problem is?
Ayla
What is it?
Karenina
The style! It's totally not my style! What the hell were they thinking when they designed something like that for me?
Ayla
Huh? That's strange... Didn't you request this coating yourself? I remember the order was addressed to you.
Karenina
Hell no! I don't need a coating like this! There's definitely been a mistake!
Now...
You got me curious.
What kind of coating is it?
Ayla
You'll know once Karenina puts it on.
Karenina
I told you it won't suit me...
Still...
Ayla's right. You won't know for sure until you try it on.
Karenina
Commandant?! How can you...?!
Ayla
Exactly! How will you know whether it suits you if you don't try it on?
Karenina
Ugh... If I'm just trying it on... but still...
Karenina's resolve begins to waver under your combined pressure.
Karenina
Fine... I know WGAA has put a lot of effort and resources into making it. It's a bit of a waste not to try it out, isn't it...
Ayla
Please give us a moment, then, Commandant—
Ayla pulls Karenina into a nearby building, and a flushed Karenina in a new coating, pushed by Ayla, steps out reluctantly moments later.
Ayla
Ta-da! What do you think, Commandant? This design has received widespread acclaim within WGAA!
Ayla
It's undeniably perfect now that Karenina has put it on!
Karenina
A-are you kidding me?!
Karenina
How can I... This doesn't suit me at all...
Karenina's voice trembles as if her strength has been drained by the new coating, her often tough demeanor melting away.
I actually think it suits you quite well.
Hmm... I also think it's not quite right.
Karenina
Ugh... Are you sure? Did you plan this with Ayla?
Ayla
Com—man—dant! Take a good look at it before you make any comments!
Karenina does look vastly different from usual in the tailored dress paired with sparkling accessories.
It is not hard to empathize with how Karenina is feeling. She probably has never tried this style of clothing before.
It's hard to imagine you in these clothes...
But it's indeed a breath of fresh air.
Ayla
Exactly! One of WGAA's main principles in designing coatings is to explore the potential people have yet to notice in themselves!
Ayla
But still, the wearer's opinion matters the most. If you really don't like it...
Karenina
Well... I...
You expect Karenina to outright reject, but she actually seems indecisive for some reason.
Yo, Ayla! I finally found you. Hm? Gray Raven Commandant? Captain? You're here too?
The Construct with pink hair—Teddy, the Vice-Captain of the Engineering Force—greets the three of you.
Karenina
T-Teddy? Why are you here?
Teddy's appearance seems to have flustered Karenina, who probably does not want any acquaintances to see her in this getup.
Teddy
I'm here to deal with some work matters with WGAA. It's nothing major. Just go ahead and enjoy your vacation.
Teddy
Oh? You're wearing the new coating already? I thought they'd need at least two or three more days to finish it.
Karenina
TEDDY! You did this, didn't you?!
Frustrated, Karenina leaps to grab Teddy's shoulders, but Teddy quickly takes a step back and dodges her.
Teddy
Hmm? You don't like it? That can't be... I think you're at least three times more eye-catching than usual. Everything looks surprisingly great on you.
Teddy
That makes all our revisions worthwhile... What a shame. Should've given you the less perfect one so that I can keep this one for myself.
Karenina
All "our" revisions...?
Teddy
Yeah. Didn't you always say you wanted a new coating? The squad talked about it and decided to chip in for one as a gift.
Teddy
I hate to admit it, but you've always looked out for us. We wanted to thank you for it.
Teddy
We wanted something casual at first, but then someone mentioned your secret love of rock music, so we ended up with this.
Teddy
We even researched a lot of Golden Age data. It's said that young women used to dress like this when they sang.
Karenina
Are you sure you looked up the correct information?!
Ayla
The video data WGAA has are limited, but its quality and authenticity are guaranteed!
Ayla
I remember it was Leonie who gathered the data. There was a word for this style in the Golden Age... an "idol," I think.
Teddy
Anyway, it fits you pretty well, doesn't it? Why not wear it for your Paradise Festival performance?
Karenina
You...
So... what exactly is this Paradise Festival?
Karenina
Huh? Don't you know?
Ayla
It was just an event started by the awakened machines originally, mainly consisting of galleries, concerts, and parade floats.
Ayla
After WGAA heard they were planning a festival in Constellia, we wondered if it was possible to expand it and include both humans and Constructs.
Teddy

The Engineering Force happens to be setting up a wired network in the Clean Zone centered around Constellia. Once it's up, we'll be able to broadcast the performances to the new conservation areas as a signal test.
Teddy
After all, the Engineering Force did snag the spot for the grand finale.
Teddy
Unfortunately... the two people scheduled to perform were caught neglecting their duty for rehearsal during work hours by the disciplinary team and are detained right now.
What were they going to perform?
Ayla
Let's see... They're a duo band, apparently? Those two are also nominal members of WGAA, occasionally performing in salons.
Karenina
I know them. The Engineering Force was dragged to support them once for their show, and we were the only people in the audience that night.
Teddy
Why don't you step in, then? The grumpy Engineering Force Captain lighting up the stage at a crucial moment would definitely be a showstopper.
Karenina
You wish. I refuse.
Karenina
And who's grumpy now?!
That said...
Your makeshift performance with Thunder Sparks has perhaps triggered some buried nostalgia. Watching Karenina, you cannot help but let some snippets of your thoughts slip out of your mouth.
I'm actually quite curious to see Karenina on stage...
Karenina
W-what did you say?!
The Paradise Festival is a rare opportunity, right?
This coating really is perfect for the stage.
Karenina
Even if you say so...
While Karenina hesitates, the murmur of voices and footsteps begins to fill the other side of the street.
It appears that the two groups came from Akdilek and Kowloong respectively, having converged on their way to the city center by chance.
The leading figures begin to walk over in your direction upon spotting Karenina and the others.
Sophia
Long time no see, Babylonians.
Hanying
This should be the first time we met, but we might have seen each other before if you've been to Kowloong recently.
Karenina
Kowloong and Akdilek? How rare.
What brings you here?
Sophia
Akdilek was invited, so Jamilah sent me here to investigate the business potential here.
Sophia pulls out an invitation from her pocket and hands it to Teddy and Ayla.
The invitation is a thin postcard wrapped in thick cardstock that summarizes the events of the Paradise Festival, signed by "Neo Universal Toys".
Teddy
An invitation? Did the mechanoids make it? And the sender... I remember a Golden Age company with a similar name, but I doubt it still exists after the Punishing Virus outbreak.
Ayla
Hmm... They also seem to have a talent agency that works for mechanoid bands. I guess this is something similar.
Hanying
Kowloong received a similar letter. Lord Chaofeng was quite surprised.
It's rare to see someone from Kowloong here.
Ayla
Isn't it great? The more the merrier! It's going to be an exciting festival!
Sophia
I'd like to know more details about this Paradise Festival so Akdilek can plan our next business venture here.
Basically...
Bang!
You are about to recount what you have learned from Ayla and Teddy when a sudden explosion from afar interrupts you.
You look up and notice the sound coming from the windmill tower in the center of Constellia.
Someone has placed a giant cannon at the top of the tower, and each booming shot fires countless ribbons and paper pieces that the windmill sends down to every corner of the city.
All mechanoids and humans in the city instinctively reach out to catch the paper floating in the wind.
It is the same invitation to the Paradise Festival that Sophia and others have received.
The small card is written in a font that makes you want to read it aloud—
Welcome to Constellia for the Paradise Festival!
Teddy
Isn't this display a little too over the top...?
Ayla
What a brilliant way to invite everyone in the town! It's going to take some time to clean up though...
Just as you are reveling in the anticipation of the festival, you suddenly feel a cold sensation on your wrist.
Karenina...?
Karenina
Shh. No questions. Just follow me.
Karenina grabs you and asks you to stay quiet for the moment.
Karenina
I'm sorry, but Commandant and I still have something to do. Please excuse us.
Karenina
By the way, Teddy, I guess you can sign me up if you can't find anyone else.
Karenina stammers through gritted teeth at Teddy before more or less pulling you away in front of everyone.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory672.jpg
Karenina
Phew... No one is following us, right?
Having run past most of the block, Karenina finally stops before a dark alley.
What are you up to?
Karenina
Follow me and you'll see.
Pulling you with her, Karenina begins to navigate the maze-like alleys.
You start to feel disoriented after the third or the fourth turn, but Karenina shows no signs of getting lost, seemingly familiar with the layout here.
Eventually, you follow Karenina into a small underground space through a door unlocked by her voiceprint.
Where are we...?
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory780.jpg
The room's lights turn on the moment you step inside as if triggered.
It looks like a storage space at first glance, but the decor and the items stored here clearly suggest that this has been transformed into a highly customized secret base.

Divided by a series of monitors in the center, the left half of the room is filled with shelves where various mechanical parts and tools like wrenches, screwdrivers, and welding torches are neatly arranged.
On the other side is a small stage where various musical instruments and Golden Age band posters hang on the wall.
Karenina
This is a small base of mine. You were talking about bands, so I thought I'd show you around.
Karenina
I did a small favor for some awakened machines when I was stationed here, and they gave me the right to use this place as a thank-you.
Karenina
I've since used it to store things I've collected from the surface and those I can't bring back to my dormitory.
Karenina
Things have piled up before I realize it. By the way, you are the only person who knows about this place, so keep it a secret. Otherwise...
Karenina purses her lips and looks at you, threatening you and pleading at once. You nod, and she smiles in contentment before walking around in her secret base.
Karenina
Not to brag, but these are some rare collectibles. Although I haven't found what I want the most, these are enough to make those WGAA people envy me.
She picks up a retro-looking guitar from the wall and sits next to you. Stroking the strings gently with a pick, she plays a few melodic notes that echo in the room.
Karenina
Sounds good, right? I met a mechanoid named Kiske who taught me how it works, and I've been calibrating it since.
Kiske? He's a pretty good guitarist indeed.
Karenina
You know him too? I've seen their band perform. I hate to say it, but they are way better than those two in the Engineering Force.
Karenina
He even asked me to be their backup performer, saying that their members tend to disappear quite often.
Did you refuse?
Did you agree?
Karenina
I did. I don't usually have that much time.
Karenina
Nah, I turned him down. I'm the Engineering Force Captain. I can't be distracted by things like this when I have missions to focus on.
Karenina
I don't know much about playing music anyway. This antique collection is just a hobby of mine.
But you do want to try it, don't you?
Karenina
Hmm...
You wouldn't have brought me here otherwise.
Karenina
Ahem... I-I had no choice! Teddy and the others worked hard to secure the slot. I can't let it go to waste.
Karenina
The Engineering Force has been so busy with the construction of the Clean Zone that I only got this vacation because Teddy and the others applied on my behalf. Now I see I'm a part of their plan.
They probably wanted you to enjoy the festival.
You're so hands-on all the time, after all.
Karenina
Maybe you're right. Those guys. Why couldn't they just tell me? I wonder who they learned it from...
Karenina softly complains about her teammates acting on their own before letting slip a subtle smile.
Karenina
...Hey, I'm going to ask you again. Do you really think this coating suits me?
Karenina moves a bit closer, and you can see she is hoping your answer will help her make up her mind.
It suits you well.
Karenina
Really? Do I still look like me in it?
Who else is standing before me?
You're Karenina, no matter what you wear.
It might even be better this way, wearing a new coating and feeling a bit different.
Karenina
Karenina
Hmph... You better be telling the truth.
Karenina lowers her head, taking another look at this new and unfamiliar version of herself.
Karenina
It's rare that I get to do something different... I have to say, it feels pretty interesting.
Karenina
Alright, I've made up my mind. I'll do this, but I'll make sure to sign the entire Engineering Force up next time if I mess it up.
Karenina
And you're gonna help too.
Me?
Karenina
Of course. Why else would I have brought you here?
Karenina
Didn't you say it suits me? You've got to help me!
Karenina
The arrangement, the lyrics, and the dance, if necessary. That's a lot of work even if we start now.
I'm a complete amateur, just so you know.
Karenina
It's fine! I'm no expert as well. Relax.
Karenina
Still, we have to treat it seriously even if it is only for entertainment. We can't do things half-heartedly now that we've decided to participate.
Karenina
If they give out prizes in the end, we'll have to strive for first place!
Having made up her mind, Karenina immediately becomes more enthusiastic. No matter what she does, this aspect of her personality never changes.
Karenina
There's still a week before the festival starts. The performance is scheduled for the last day.
Karenina
There's time, but not much. Anyway, let's do our best.
